verb.description: To cause (a person) to be preoccupied with or by a feeling, notion, etc.; to preoccupy with or by; to imbue, inspire, or affect strongly beforehand.
To influence (a person) in advance against or in favour of a person or thing; to bias, prejudice. Now also frequently: to make a favourable impression on.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Heywood (c1573–1641), playwright and poet. From pre- + possess.
